speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: SCENE IV. Another part of the field.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Enter SALISBURY, PEMBROKE, and BIGOT

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: I did not think the king so stored with friends.

speaker: PEMBROKE
text_entry: Up once again; put spirit in the French:

speaker: PEMBROKE
text_entry: If they miscarry, we miscarry too.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: That misbegotten devil, Faulconbridge,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: In spite of spite, alone upholds the day.

speaker: PEMBROKE
text_entry: They say King John sore sick hath left the field.

speaker: PEMBROKE
text_entry: Enter MELUN, wounded

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: Lead me to the revolts of England here.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: When we were happy we had other names.

speaker: PEMBROKE
text_entry: It is the Count Melun.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Wounded to death.

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: Fly, noble English, you are bought and sold;

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: Unthread the rude eye of rebellion

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: And welcome home again discarded faith.

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: Seek out King John and fall before his feet;

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: For if the French be lords of this loud day,

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: He means to recompense the pains you take

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: By cutting off your heads: thus hath he sworn

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: And I with him, and many moe with me,

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: Upon the altar at Saint Edmundsbury;

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: Even on that altar where we swore to you

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: Dear amity and everlasting love.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: May this be possible? may this be true?

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: Have I not hideous death within my view,

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: Retaining but a quantity of life,

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: Which bleeds away, even as a form of wax

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: Resolveth from his figure 'gainst the fire?

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: What in the world should make me now deceive,

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: Since I must lose the use of all deceit?

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: Why should I then be false, since it is true

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: That I must die here and live hence by truth?

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: I say again, if Lewis do win the day,

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: He is forsworn, if e'er those eyes of yours

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: Behold another day break in the east:

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: But even this night, whose black contagious breath

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: Already smokes about the burning crest

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: Of the old, feeble and day-wearied sun,

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: Even this ill night, your breathing shall expire,

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: Paying the fine of rated treachery

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: Even with a treacherous fine of all your lives,

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: If Lewis by your assistance win the day.

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: Commend me to one Hubert with your king:

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: The love of him, and this respect besides,

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: For that my grandsire was an Englishman,

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: Awakes my conscience to confess all this.

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: In lieu whereof, I pray you, bear me hence

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: From forth the noise and rumour of the field,

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: Where I may think the remnant of my thoughts

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: In peace, and part this body and my soul

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: With contemplation and devout desires.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: We do believe thee: and beshrew my soul

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: But I do love the favour and the form

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Of this most fair occasion, by the which

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: We will untread the steps of damned flight,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: And like a bated and retired flood,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Leaving our rankness and irregular course,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Stoop low within those bounds we have o'erlook'd

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: And cabby run on in obedience

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Even to our ocean, to our great King John.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: My arm shall give thee help to bear thee hence;

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: For I do see the cruel pangs of death

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Right in thine eye. Away, my friends! New flight;

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: And happy newness, that intends old right.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Exeunt, leading off MELUN
